Title: the agreement dissection

Scene: A Korean ballroom dancing club. Sheldon and Amy are dancing.
The apartment. Sheldon is at his laptop.
Sheldon: Leonard, are you in the shower?
I asked if you were in the shower, but that’s moot now.
Moot. Rendered unimportant by recent events.
I have to skip the chitchat. Emergency.
Mathematical. 32-ounce banana smoothie, 16-ounce bladder.
I assure you I do.
What?
What are you doing in there? She can’t be in here.
According to the roommate agreement, paragraph nine, subsection B, the right to bathroom privacy is suspended in the event of force majeure. And believe me, I am experiencing a very majeure force.
Come on, you can’t wait two minutes?
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny?
Move. Move. Move!
Dr. Leonard Hofstadter, you are officially charged with two violations of the roommate agreement. Do you waive reading of the charges?

Very well. Count the first, on or about the 28th day of April, the accused did knowingly and with malice aforethought deny access to the shared bathroom in a time of emergency, to wit, my back teeth were floating. Count the second, the accused exceeded the agreed upon occupancy of the shower, to wit, one, unless we are under attack by water-soluble aliens.
Um, it’s fairly technical.
Do so, do so.
Oh, that’s ridiculous. A bathroom emergency is self-explanatory.
Irrelevant. Leonard doesn’t trim his nose hair. He thinks because he’s short nobody can see up there.
But…
This isn’t over.
What is that you’re eating? Tonight is pizza night.
Yes, and when Franconi’s went out of business, we switched to Graziano’s.
No.
This is Greek food? Leonard, you hate Greek food.
Fine. I’m nothing if not adaptable.

Thank you. If you think about it, Greek food isn’t that far from italian food. They share a spice palette. And what a civilization is the Greeks. They gave us science, democracy, and little cubes of charred meat that taste like sweat.
(Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny? (Knock, knock, knock) Penny?
The mean Indian lady tried to make me eat lamb. Congratulations. Pizza night will now be at your apartment. Order one.
A girls night? Oh, I don’t know if I’m up for an evening talking about rainbows, unicorns and menstrual cramps.
Shotgun.
Really, Amy? Tobacco and alcohol? Need I remind you not a lot of scientific discoveries were made by people having a good time?
It’s talc. But as that’s a primary ingredient of baby powder, I understand your confusion.
I don’t know how to process that.

Other than my mother, my sister and my mee-maw, no. But in the interest of full disclosure, I was once on a bus and had to give mouth-to-mouth resuscitation to an elderly nun who passed out from heat exhaustion. Every year I get a Christmas card from her, signed with far too many X’s and O’s.
Thank you. Not necessary. We know everything there is to know about kissing. It requires 34 facial muscles and 112 postural muscles.
I’m certainly glad no one said they were curious about Aztec human sacrifice.
No, thank you, but for the record, I’m an excellent dancer. Proficient in the rumba, waltz and cha-cha.
I don’t see why that’s surprising. I excel at so many things. You’ve had my sourdough bread.

Against my will. In the South, pre-adolescent children are forced through a process called cotillion, which indoctrinates them with all the social graces and dance skills needed to function in 18th century Vienna.
No, you most certainly are not.
I saved a nun’s life. Why am I being punished?

Waltz. It’s a social dance from Austria, choreographed to a three-four time signature. (Sings Blue Danube. The taxi driver says something into radio in Korean. The word “waltz” is included. Dispatcher replies also in Korean. Taxi driver sings Blue Danube. Dispatcher says “oh, waltz!” They speak Korean some more. )
What happened to you?
What’s 16 times 14?
And there’s your answer.
If you’re referring to the beverage, you know I don’t drink. If you’re referring to the hat you don while wearing a nightshirt and holding a candle, I have one.
It’s hard to say no to yoo-hoo. The name literally beckons.
Thank you. Is someone smoking?
You own a smoking monkey?
What’s he doing here?
Remarkable. Aren’t you worried about secondhand smoke?
is he deliberately blowing smoke at me?
Thank you. May I share something with you that’s troubling me?
Priya has essentially nullified my roommate agreement with Leonard, making life in the apartment very uncomfortable for me.
No, of course not.
I understand the alcohol has stirred up whatever it is that makes girls go wild, but I really need to talk to smart Amy now.
No.
Well, when challenged, monkeys generally assert their dominance through chasing, assault and a stylized penile display. That’s a little outside my comfort zone.
Are you suggesting I play dirty?
Fascinating.
Oh, good, you’re up. I’ve written a new and improved roommate agreement that benefits me greatly. I’d like you to sign it.
Excellent question. Do you remember what happened to the alien, played by talented character actor Frank Gorshin, in the Star Trek episode Let That Be Your Last Battlefield?
Affirmative. Computer, this is Dr. Sheldon Cooper. Activate self-destruct sequence. Code 1-1-A-2-B.
That was my first thought, but all my cool stuff is here.

Unless Leonard signs the new agreement in the next 41 seconds, this computer will send an e-mail to your parents in India saying that you’re in a secret relationship with the whiter-than-marshmallow-fluff Leonard Hofstadter.
20 seconds.
He does that all the time, doesn’t he? 15.
I never bluff. Ten.
Nine.
Eight.
It’s a laptop with a full charge. Honestly, what do you see in him?
Three.
Two.
You may have gone to Cambridge, but I’m an honorary graduate of Starfleet academy.
Good morning, Amy.
Are you experiencing dehydration, headache, nausea and shame?
Ah, memory impairment, the free prize at the bottom of every vodka bottle.

All right. Last night you gave me some excellent advice regarding my problem here at home, you kissed me and then vomited on and off for 40 minutes, following which you passed out on your bathroom floor. I then folded a towel under your head as a pillow, set your oven clock to the correct time because it was driving me crazy, and I left.
I suggest we treat our relationship as if it were a crashed computer and restore it to the last point we both agree it worked.
You’re preaching to the choir, sister.
Leonard: I can’t hear you, I’m in the shower.
What?
I can’t hear you, I’m in the shower.
What kind of emergency?
You might not want to do that.
Sheldon, I’m not alone in here.
We were in here first, you can’t be in here.
Yeah, fine.
Oh. Cool. I’ve got a lawyer. And I’ve seen her naked.
Top of her class, Cambridge University. Licensed to practice law in three countries. And your face.
Schooled!
Superceded!
No offence, but shower sex with you is now the second best thing that’s happened today.
I’d like to refer that to my attorney.
Not as much as you.
I got you the lamb kabob.
Morning, Sheldon.
Why would I want to do that?
Uh, Captain Kirk activated the self-destruct sequence and threatened to blow up the Enterpriseand kill them both unless he gave in?
What are you gonna do, Sheldon, blow up the apartment?
What’s the big deal?
They’re gonna find out about me eventually, right?
Are you ashamed of me?
Then why can’t we tell your parents?
No, he’s bluffing.
It’s blackmail!
This is ridiculous. (Pulls out plug)
Really?
Okay, I’ll sign it!
Priya: Hello, Sheldon.
Oh, Leonard, let the man pee.
Hang on. No, my client does not waive reading of the charges.
Proceed.
Can I see the roommate agreement?
I think I can handle it.
All right, based on a cursory reading, it doesn’t look like you have much of a case, Sheldon.
Oh, I’m afraid not. Section seven here, on the right to enter the bathroom in emergency situations, is not specific as to what constitutes an emergency.
Is it? If Leonard forgot to trim his nose hair, could he barge in while you were showering?
My point is, Sheldon, the legal principle is ambiguity in a contract benefits the party that did not draft it, in this case, Leonard. So much for count one.
There’s no buts, Sheldon, that’s how the law works.

As for the shower capacity issue, I cite addendum J. When Sheldon showers second, any and all measures shall be taken to ensure an adequate supply of hot water. I believe this supercedes the occupancy issue.
Seriously?
According to what I see here, Thursday nights are Franconi’s pizza night.

A good question, Howard. Turns out you can’t. According to the document you drew up, Sheldon, the selection of a new takeout restaurant requires public hearings and a 60-day comment period. Were those criteria met?
So what happens when it counts down?
Oh, my God.
Trust me, it’s a big deal.
Yeah, of course, just not today.
Of course not.
Please, don’t push this.
Okay, fine, Sheldon, you win. Turn it off.
We give up.
Give him what he wants or we’re done.
Penny: Oh, I’m sorry, honey, I’m meeting Amy and Bernadette for dinner. But you’re welcome to tag along.
Okay, suit yourself. We’ll probably be trashing Priya a little.
Okay, I’d like to propose a toast to a wonderful girls night out.
I felt sorry for him. Priya’s giving him a hard time.
That’s too many S’s for kissing.
Sheldon, have you ever kissed a girl?
Yeah, you’re a scientist, where is the curiosity?
Hey, I know, let’s take Sheldon dancing.
Oh, we are so taking you dancing.
Take us to a place we can waltz.
Raj: Mmm, Greek food on pizza night? This is the most delightfully cruel thing we’ve done to Sheldon since we left that fake message from Stephen Hawking on his voice mail.
Howard: That’s interesting. Can you just switch restaurants like that, Priya?
Amy: Fair warning, we can get ker-razy.
Why did you bring him? He’s harshing my buzz.
I need some context.
And that opens her up To justifiable ridicule for wearing them. Good one, Bernadette. See? Ker-razy.
You smell like baby powder.
Oh, I’m not confused at all. You’re like a sexy toddler.
I’m available for experimentation.
Oh, blah, blah, blah. Give me some sugar, bestie (kisses Penny).
Really?
How come if we’re the smart people, we don’t do this every night?
My burps taste like cranberry juice.
Would you like to come in for a nightcap?
I have yoo-hoo.
Make yourself comfortable.
Oh, that’s just Ricky.
Don’t be silly. He’s one of the animals in my department’s nicotine addiction study.
I’m giving him emphysema. The least I can do is let him hang out and watch cable.
A little. The real danger is him biting my face off while I’m sleeping.
Yeah. He’s kind of an ass.
Of course. What’s rattling around that big bulbous brain of yours?
And you want me to kill her? Done.
I trained Ricky how to smoke. I can train him to shoot a poison dart. No jury would convict us ’cause people love monkeys.
Excuse me. Have you considered that your intelligence might be the very thing causing your dilemma?
What do you think Ricky over here would do if an interloper encroached on his territory?
You’re being too literal. My point is, he would not meekly surrender to the rules, and neither should you.
Yes, dirty. Dirty, dirty, dirty. Which brings me to our next order of business. (Kisses him)
I hope you don’t take what I’m about to do as a comment on what we just did. (Runs to bathroom and vomits)
It most assuredly is not.
Yes. I also found a Korean man’s business card tucked into my cleavage. What happened last night?
Sheldon?
Okay. Don’t really know where we go from here.
Terrific. Thank you. (Noise of Ricky in background) They were out of menthols! Get off my back! Not easy living with a temperamental little primate.
Bernadette: Yeah. Last week we smoked cigars and pretended to be dragons.
Ooh, the Priya bashing’s starting early. Yay! Okay, what’s up with those pantsuits?
I do. Amy and Sheldon sitting in a tree. K-I-S-S-S-S-I-N-G.
Not if they’re doing it for a long time.
That doesn’t count. Aren’t you even a little curious?
Oh, I totally want to see Sheldon dance. I bet he looks like a spider on a hot plate.
Well, what does your cotillion training say is expected of a gentleman when three ladies ask him to escort them to a dance soiree?
Amy (singing): I kissed a girl and I liked it, I hope my boyfriend don’t mind it.
Sheldon (to Ricky): Who’s to say you shouldn’t be dissecting our brains? You really are an ass.
Leonard (off): Come on, Priya, just admit I embarrass you!

Hey, I know, let’s take Sheldon dancing.

Take us to a place we can waltz.
